🇬🇧 NHS Doctor (HAES-aligned)
📘 Sunday Times Bestselling author of ‘Food Isn’t Medicine’
🤬 fighting weight stigma & nutribollocks
📧 andrew@84world.com

buttons.text: COVID-19 vaccines go through many tests for safety and effectiveness and are then monitored closely. (Source: World Health Organization)

node.text:
Let’s talk claims around infertility and then when it comes to the COVID vaccine, and why certain recommendations are made in pregnancy.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
A couple of great people to follow for more on this topic are @mamadoctorjones and @drjengunter. The @rcobsgyn website (search Google for ‘rcog covid’) also has brilliant resources for both patients and clinicians.

node.title: Can the COVID vaccine cause infertility?

node.text:
There are many examples of why the food is medicine rhetoric is harmful - this is simply the most recent.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Food is food.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Medicine is medicine.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We have to stop conflating the two.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Note: the point of this isn’t to get into a complex discussion about capacity and self-discharge from hospital.

node.text: Cries of ‘promoting ob*sity’ is simply a facade, usually from those with little insight about their own insecurities and fat phobia.

...it’s about the fact that discrimination causes real harm to people’s mental and physical well-being and we need to start taking it seriously.

Stumbled a little over my words at the end there. Meant to say that ‘poverty impacts health irrelevant of body size’, and that the conclusion of ‘ob*sity increases your risk of COVID’ was short-sighted... but I think that the message still got across!

node.text:
Fact: the poorest 10% of UK households would need to spend 74% of their disposable income on food to meet the Eatwell Guide costs. This compares to the richest 10% only having to spend 6%.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Fact: stereotypically ‘unhealthy’ (high in fat, salt and/or sugar) foods are three times cheaper than ‘healthy’ foods per kcal.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Fact: over 1.2 million people in the UK live in what are known as ‘food deserts’, areas of food insecurity where poverty, poor public transport and lack of big supermarkets severely limit access to affordable fresh fruit and vegetables. Almost 4 million children in the UK live in households that struggle to afford/access fresh fruit and vegetables.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Fact: ~1 million people in the UK are living without a fridge, ~2 million without a cooker and ~3 million without a freezer.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Food inequality is real, even if those privileged enough to have never experienced it claim it isn’t.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
References:
“The Broken Plate” - The Food Foundation
“What are the barriers to eating healthily in the UK?” - Social Market Foundation
“#LivingWithout” - Turn2us
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Clips from Episode 7 of BBC Sunday Morning Breakfast posted under fair use for both review and educational purposes.

node.text:
It still blows my mind that this even needs to be said.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Masks don’t have the ability to block gas exchange, no matter whether it’s oxygen or carbon dioxide. Can you imagine if they did? Surgeons falling unconscious as the operating table, motorcyclist passing out on roads, the sport of fencing having to be cancelled from the olympics because of how dangerous it is…
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It’s laughably ridiculous.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Today, masks/face-coverings became mandatory in shops in England and a certain proverb came to mind: “The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.” Sure, we can argue about whether this should have been implemented earlier, but that’s a separate conversation.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We know that the main mode of transmission for COVID-19 is via respiratory droplets. Mask wearing primarily limits you spreading respiratory droplets and infecting others (ultra-important when we know that asymptomatic transmission exists), but also gives you an element of protection too even though the sides aren’t tight-fitting. Many recent publications have summarised the latest evidence very well (PMID:32663243 being just one example).
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
A small minority may find themselves unable to wear a mask due to medical conditions, disabilities or mental health. Fortunately there isn’t a specific condition that automatically means you can’t (as everyone is different), so do practise wearing different types of masks in a safe environment such as at home. Just please don’t use non-filtered vented ones, otherwise you’re still expelling your droplets towards others.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
To sum up: if you’re part of the overwhelming majority that can wear a mask, do so. Don’t be selfish; let’s protect each other.

node.title: WEARING A MASK AT THE SUPERMARKET DOESN’T REDUCE OXYGEN SATURATIONS

node.text:
*EDIT: I have removed the original part of the caption which read: "there are ZERO medical conditions that mean that you cannot physically wear a mask". I have been informed that people have been using this statement as an excuse to harass/abuse individuals with disabilities for whom it simply may not be practical/possible to wear a mask. How anyone can think this is acceptable I do not understand. It is not. Remember, these people may well be the most vulnerable in society that we are wearing masks in order to protect. I apologise for the lack of nuance in the manner of my wording.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Unfortunately, there are many claiming fake medical reasons as to why they shouldn't have to do the bare minimum of wearing a mask. I will endeavour to find a better way of challenging and addressing this without negatively impacting those most vulnerable, as this is the last thing I would want to do.*
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Masks categorically do not reduce oxygen saturation. This is a lie made up as an excuse by those who believe the pandemic is a hoax and that wearing a mask somehow encroaches on their rights.

This is not an issue of freedom. If you wear a scarf around your face when it's cold you can wear a mask over your face during a pandemic. Caring about the safety and wellbeing of others means that you put your discomfort aside and choose to follow the best advice we have at the moment.

N.B. I fully understand the impact that respiratory conditions, learning difficulties and mental health (including, but not limited to, anxiety) may have on mask-wearing; this post is not to negate that.

node.title: MASKS DO NOT REDUCE OXYGEN SATURATIONS

node.text:
Comparisons in and of themselves are not the issue, it's when they are used to downplay and minimise the importance of what's going on.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
@voxdotcom made a fantastic video explaining why COVID-19 is much worse than the flu. Watch it and become familiar with it. That way you'll have something to be able to reply with when you see your friend post yet another stupid meme on Facebook.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
These two infections ARE NOT THE SAME. COVID-19 is deadlier and more infectious.

node.title: COVID-19 IS NOT THE FLU. IT'S MUCH WORSE.

node.text:
CW: footage of critically ill patients in an Italian hospital.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Please know that I wouldn't be sharing this video without wholeheartedly believing in its relevance. We all need to fully understand the situation, not to find reasons to panic, but to have to a tangible reason not to be complacent. I believe this video is very helpful at doing just that by providing insight into what hospital care of COVID-19 looks like, and to put into context why the measures to reduce the spread of disease and the inevitable burden on the healthcare service are so important to follow.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Italy not only has more doctors per capita than the UK but also has double the number of critical care beds per capita than we do. We are about 2 weeks behind in regards to the healthcare burden.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Of course, there are differences between countries, but to use this as a reason to say we can't compare (as I have seen some public-facing doctors doing recently) is incomprehensibly stupid. Our NHS is amazing, but it's not bulletproof - it's been underfunded and understaffed for over a decade. We need all the help we can get, including analysing data from the wider world. Finally, we cannot do this without everyone in the country taking this incredibly seriously.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We are going to work for you. Unless you have absolutely no option, please stay home for us.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
📸: @skynews

node.text:
Time for a slight change of tack in how I address vaccine misinformation.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
For those of you who have been following me for any length of time, you know I’m not shy with my direct challenge of dangerous bullshit on social media. Over the years I’ve been asked on countless occasions how many charlatans have actually changed their messaging, and although it’s actually more than I ever originally thought it would be, my response is always that it’s not about them. Far more important are those who have consumed the content… those who would so easily have been misled without a direct, informed response challenging the nonsense.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I feel I may have forgotten this fact recently when it’s come to the COVID vaccine. My emotions have got the better of me at times and I’ve had a tendency to address my content towards those spreading lies rather than those genuinely scared and confused. It’s made me feel better, kinda, but not only has it invited death threats but it’s risked alienating those of the fence due to the unintended aggression. I’m going to change that.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
These conversations at the moment are some of the most important I’m likely to ever have online. I can’t risk getting this wrong.

buttons.text: Visit the COVID-19 Information Center for vaccine resources.

node.text: A MILLION TIMES YES. You never know who’s engaging behind the scenes. Never stop challenging the misinformation.

node.text:
“The CDC are retracting the COVID PCR test - this is proof that the test never worked in the first place and COVID isn’t real!” I mean, really?! 🤡
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Up until last week, the COVID swab was a standalone test. The next step is to incorporate it into what’s known as a multiplex test so we can test for COVID and other respiratory viruses like influenza with the same swab… also known as resource management and healthcare improvement. Can someone explain to me how that got twisted into the claim that it’s being replaced because it didn’t work? Are you seriously telling me you’d rather have multiple swabs making you gag rather than just one?!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
These childish conspiracy theories are truly laughable sometimes.

node.text:
“Detoxing” footbaths are nothing but a laughable scam.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Stick a pair of metal electrodes in a salt bath and it will not only turn brown but sludge will form on top… because… chemistry. Iron is formed, the very same that causes rust. Your feet don’t even need to be in the footbath for it to happen 😅🤡.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Dr Joshua Wolrich MBBS MRCS in London, United Kingdom. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Dr Joshua Wolrich (BSc MBBS MRCS) @drjoshuawolrich To the ex-nurse in London today who publicly threatened NHS doctors and nurses working on the frontline with the noose because we are *giving the vaccine*.. fuck you. Το the mob who cheered... fuck you also. In my professional opinion, you are all a fucking disgrace to humanity.'.

node.text:
Why the fuck are we still pandering to this bullshit?! Is it going to require a healthcare profession to actually be murdered off the back of violent misinformation before someone steps in and does something?
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This isn’t a fucking joke. Too many of us (healthcare professionals) are afraid to publicly challenge and condemn the misinformation for fear of death threats and abuse. What was said at this disgraceful anti-vax rally in London today isn’t new, it just moved it from our DMs directly into the public sphere.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The ex-nurse inciting violence today already had her nursing registration removed this year for placing members of the public at serious risk of harm. More of that please. We also need the @gmcuk to start removing doctor’s licences - they’ve been far too quiet. You should lose to right to your registration when you are directly harming your patients with your authority bias.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
What a fucking mess. We need our government to actually do their job properly and stop putting out contradictory and confusing messaging. We need our professional regulatory bodies to step up and clamp down on those lying to the public. We need our medical colleges to stand in unison and address the misinformation from a place of loud confidence rather than leaving it to single ones of us online. We need the media to stop publishing stories for clickbait and recognise the impact they are having on the public’s physical and mental health.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We need compassion for those genuinely scared and confused by the misleading information out there, whilst taking absolutely no shit from those who want to push their bullshit, dangerous conspiracy theories. Enough is fucking enough.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Dr Joshua Wolrich MBBS MRCS in London, United Kingdom. May be an image of 1 person, standing and indoor.

node.text:
This is just a reminder to find some form of regular exercise that you enjoy. It can literally be anything… why are you running if you hate running?! Yes I’m talking to you. Choose something else damn it! Oh, and if you want to improve the chances of it actually being sustainable this time around, set goals that have nothing to do with appearance or weight loss… because the research says so.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Bonus points if you get to wear an absolutely ridiculous outfit whilst you do it.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Dr Joshua Wolrich MBBS MRCS in London, United Kingdom with @beat.eating.disorders, and @sl_benton_mp. May be an image of text that says 'Dr Joshua Wolrich (BSc MBBS MRCS) @drjoshuawolrich This vile bully who decided to publicly fat shame a healthcare professional online is the current co-chair of the All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eating Disorders... it doesn't take a genius to figure out why we're not making any progress through government policy does it? @ScottBentonMP 23h Scott Benton MP Replying to @colldash More than one free pasty suspect by the looks of it'.

node.text:
At the VERY least, Scott Benton (@sl_benton_mp) should be removed from his role immediately. Anyone who thinks it appropriate to fat shame someone that brazenly should have absolutely zero impact on how the government views eating disorders. Of course, that won’t happen without noise as there is classically zero fucking accountability.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I will be sending an email to both Wera Hobhouse (wera.hobhouse.mp@parliament.uk) who is the chair of the committee, and Sophie Clark at @beat.eating.disorders (appg@beateatingdisorders.org.uk) who is the official public enquiry point. Scott Benton’s job as a member of parliament is to serve us, the public. He is no longer fit for his role in this group in any way shape or form. Please either join me in emailing, or send me an email directly with your concerns and I will collate them. These kind of actions cannot be allowed to slide and be ignored. The eating disorder community deserve so much better.

node.text:
Today (16th July) only, the ebook version of my book is on sale for 99p in the UK. Kindle, Apple Books, Google Play Store, Kobo… essentially it’s worth checking wherever ebooks are sold. You can even download the free kindle app on your computer and get it that way. I talk a lot about socioeconomics and inequality throughout, so the fact it’s so close to free makes me so bloody excited. I truly and honestly think this book is a great place to start if you want to challenge some of diet culture and start working on your relationship with food. If you hate it, email me and I’ll send you your pound back.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
To all of you outside of the UK, I love you too I promise. If it ends up going on sale elsewhere I’ll let you know!

node.text:
TW: eating disorders
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I’ve been going back and forth as to whether I should be talking publicly about this, but being in recovery from an eating disorder doesn’t give you a pass to publish hatred towards others without criticism. I pray that my additional fear for her well-being is misplaced.

node.text: Moderation through fear is actually restriction… and restriction only serves to worsen your relationship with food.
